abstract.text: An object that contains the specific font, style, and weight attributes to apply to a symbol image.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Symbol image configuration objects include details such as the point size, scale, text style, and weight to apply to your symbol image. The system uses these details to determine which variant of the image to use and how to scale or style the image.

code: accessibilityDescription: "A multiply symbol inside a filled circle.") {

inlineContent.text: objects are immutable after you create them. If you use the
method on the object, the new image attributes replace any previous attributes you supplied. After creating a symbol configuration object, assign it to the
object you use to display the image. If you draw the image directly, use the
method to create a new image that contains the new attributes.

abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.
Constants that specify the preferred text styles you use with fonts.
A high-level interface for manipulating image data.
An object that contains the specific font, style, and weight attributes to apply to a symbol image.
Creates a configuration object by applying the values from the configuration you specify.
Creates a hierarchical color configuration using the color you specify.
Creates a color configuration by specifying a palette of colors.
Creates a symbol configuration with the specified point size and font weight.
Creates a symbol configuration with the specified point size, font weight, and symbol scale.
Creates a symbol configuration using the scale you specify.
Creates a symbol configuration with the specified text style.
Creates a symbol configuration with the specified text style and symbol scale.
Creates a configuration that specifies that the symbol should prefer its multicolor variant if one exists.
Constants that specify which scale variant of a symbol image to use.
Creates a new symbol image with the specified configuration.
A display of image data in a frame.
The root class of most Objective-C class hierarchies, from which subclasses inherit a basic interface to the runtime system and the ability to behave as Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A protocol that objects adopt to provide functional copies of themselves.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A protocol that enables encoding and decoding in a manner that is robust against object substitution attacks.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
